literary.Event:
English Debate
Team Size: 2 from each University/College, one for the motion & the other against the motion
Time limit: Each member will be given 4 minutes to speak and 1 minute to refute. The refutation shall begin with the last speaker. 1st warning Buzzer will be after 3 minutes.
Topic: Issue for the Debate will be decided by the Faculty Coordinators of the event.
1. Topic will be available on the Resurgence website 2 days prior to the event or will be inform to your Manager.
2. Medium of presentation is English only.
3. Paper reading is not allowed. One may however refer to noted points.
Judging Criteria: Voice Modulation (including suitable use of accents), content, suitability and propriety of language
Matter: the logical reasoning and content presented by the debater
Manner: presentation and delivery, the style of speaking and body language.
Method: structure and organization of the presentation made by the speakers. Refutation.

Hindi Debate

Time limit: Each member will be given 4 minutes to speak and 1 minute to refute. The refutation shall begin with the last speaker. 1st warning Buzzer will be after 3 minutes.
Topic: Issue for the Debate will be decided by the Faculty Coordinators of the event.
1. Topic will be available on the Resurgence website 2 days prior to the event or will be inform to your Manager.
2. Medium of presentation is English only.
3. Paper reading is not allowed. One may however refer to noted points.

Matter: the logical reasoning and content presented by the debater
Manner: presentation and delivery, the style of speaking and body language.

Group Extempore
Team Size: 3 from each University/College Time limit: 2 minutes for each participant 1. Topic will be announced on the spot. 2. For each team there will be a different topic.
3. The first speaker shall begin speaking after 2 minutes of getting the topic.
4. Each participant of a team will be given 2 minutes.
5. After 2 minutes, there will be a Buzzer and the next member will take over where the last speaker finishes.
Judging Criteria: Creativity, Spontaneity, Body language, Voice modulation, intensity and coverage of the content

Quiz
Team Size: 3 from each house. Rules: 1. The Quiz will be based on the following topics: Science, Geog., History & Culture, Sports, Current Affairs 2. The Specific rules regarding evaluation procedure, time to reply a particular answer and the type of round will be given before the actual start of the competition.

Poetry
Team Size: 2 (1 for English and 1 for Hindi) from each House Time limit: 3-5 minutes for each recitation 1. Topic will be given only two hours before the event and the participant is required to write poetry in a place specified by the event coordinators. 2. Medium of poetry is English and Hindi (although restricted use of Urdu may be allowed). 3. The participant will have to submit the content of the poem in writing to the judges after the recitation. Judging Criteria: Choice of words, diction, creativity, and style of recitation, relevance to the theme

Essay Writing
Team Size: 2 (individual) from each House Time limit: 2 hours. 1. The topic will be announced on the spot. 2. The essay should reflect participant’s point of view. 3. The essay should be between 300-600 words. 4. The language of writing is English/Hindi. Judging criteria: 1. Language 2. Articulation 3. Argumentation and Justification. 4. Counter arguments and their criticism. 5. A viable conclusion.

Creative Writing
Team Size: 2 from each House Time limit: 3 hours. 1. The situation/theme and first line of the story will be announced on the spot. 2. The participants are required to make a well-formed, original story. The situation/theme may belong to any time, any era, any place, and any culture. The level of expression must appropriate the character of the situation/theme. 3. The story should be of 500 – 1200 words. 4. The language of writing can be English/Hindi. Judging criteria: 1. Ability to captivate the reader till the end 2. Originality and articulation.

music.Event:
Sangam
Team Size: 5-8 including the accompanist.
Time limit: 6-10 minutes (including setup and clearance time)
Rules:
1. A team member can sing and play an instrument as well. However such a person would be counted as both vocalist and accompanist. 2. Only Piano mode in key board is allowed, touch sense is allowed in keyboard and guitars will have to be played in clean mode. No processing of any kind including distortion will be allowed.   3. Time Limit should be strictly followed. Participants will be penalized by judges for not doing so. 4. The decision of the organizers with respect to line-up would be final. 5. The decision of the judges will be binding. 6. The team may sing more than one song within the time limit. 7. Karaoke not allowed. Judging Criteria: Content, Delivery and quality of Vocals, Presentation, Synchronization, Stage presence and overall performance as a group.

Light Indian Vocal
Team Size: 1 participant from each house + 5 accompanists (max) Dress Code: Contestants are asked to wear appropriate attire to the competition. Time limit: 3-5 minutes for performance + 3 minutes for set up and clearance Instruments Provided: 2 Guitars, 1 Bass, 1 Drum Kit, 1 Synthesizer and 1 Tabla-set 1. The participants are required to come prepared with a song of their choice to showcase their versatility. 2. Ghazal/bhajan/shabad/Sufi and Abhangas can be presented. 3. Karaoke not allowed. 4. Accompanists from other houses are allowed. Judging Criteria: Judgment is on the qualities like Swara, Taal, Innovation, Synchronization, Selection of Raga, Composition and Overall Impression.

Western Vocals
Team Size: 1-2 from each House +5 accompanists (max) Dress Code: Contestants are asked to wear appropriate attire to the competition. Time limit: 3-5 minutes for performance + 3 minutes for set up and clearance Instruments Provided: 2 Guitars, 1 Bass Guitar, 1 Drum Kit and 1 Synthesizer. 1. Only Western songs with no classical tinge are allowed. 2. Genres can be anything ranging from Rock to Rap and from Death Metal to Soft Singing. 3. Language of the song can be anything excluding those of Indian Subcontinents. 4. Karaoke not allowed. 5. Accompanists from other houses are allowed. Judging Criteria: Judgment is made on the qualities like rhythm, vocals, composition coordination and overall impression

Hindi Duet
Team Size: 2 from each house + 5 accompanists (max) Dress Code: Contestants are asked to wear appropriate attire to the competition. Time Limit: 5 minutes for performance + 2 minutes for set up and clearance Instruments Provided: 2 Guitars, 1 Bass, 1 Drum Kit, 1 Synthesizer and 1 Tabla-set 1. The participants have to come prepared with a song of their choice to showcase their versatility. 2. The songs must have Hindi lyrics. 3. Karaoke not allowed. 4. Accompanists from other houses are allowed. Judging Criteria: Synchronization, Presentation, Rhythm, delivery and quality of vocals and overall impact

Instrumental
Team Size: 2-10 participants from each house Time Limit: 5-8 minutes for performance + 2 minutes for set up and clearance Instruments provided: As per requirements. (Participants may bring their own instruments but must inform to the music coordinators 2 days prior to the event). 1. The participants have to come prepared with an instrumental song (fusion is allowed). 2. In the use of any electronic keyboard, no pre-programmed music is allowed. 3. The contestant must create all sound live on stage. 4. Non-traditional instruments can be used. 5. Accompanists from other houses are not allowed. Judging Criteria: Melody, synchronization, audience response, stage presentation, creativity.

dance.Event:
Desi Beat.
1-No. of Participants 8-12.
2-Time limit 5-8 minutes.
3-Only Bollywood tracks are allowed.
4-Remixes of the tracks in the playlist cannot be used. You have to use original versions
5-Performers have to clear the stage after their performance otherwise they will be penalized heavily by the organizers.
6-Voice-overs must not exceed 1 minute.
Judging Criteria: Choreography, Energy, Synchronization, Expressions, Stage utilization, Costumes, Overall impact (it includes how well the teams have brought about a filmy look to the dance)

Classical Solo
1-No. of Participants 1 from each university/college.
2-Time limit 3-5 minutes.
3-Music should be of any Indian Classical style or Semi Classical Style.
4-Dance should be only of Classical i.e., Bharatnatyam,Kuchipudi, Mohiniyattam, Kathak, Odissi, etc.
Judging Criteria: Expressions, Dance Movements, Creativity

Nrittyangan
1-Team Size: 8-12 dancers + 6(Accompanists)
2-The performance will be held in Matrika Auditorium with audience on front sides.
3-TIME LIMIT: 5-7 minutes (+3 min setup and clearance time)
4-Use of a prop is allowed.
5-Use of Live Song with Live Instrument is allowed (optional).
6-Submit the Story before the Event.
Judging Criteria: Story {Concept}, Synchronization, Stage utilization, Choreography, Expressions, Costumes, Overall impact.

Project Street Dance
1-Team Size: 8-12 members.
2-Stage: Circular BC Junction with audience on all sides.
3-Time Limit:
1st round: 60 sec each
2nd round: 120 sec each
3rd round: 3-5 minutes each
4-
A: In round 1 each university/college need to send 2 participants that will perform solo dance on the spot music.
B: In round 2 each university/college need to send 2 participants that will perform duet dance on the spot music.
C: In round 3 each university/college need to send 8-12 participants that will perform group dance on the spot music.
5-Teams need to perform a dance sequence without any theme for the same.
6-Participants must incorporate any style(s) from Hip-Hop, Popping, Tutting, Krumping, Breakdance, Stepping, Buoying, Contraptions and Western Freestyle in their dance performance.
Judging criteria: The Hip-hop group battle will be judged based on the breaking skills the team has got and its presentation. It depends on crowd support.
Choreography, Energy, Synchronization, Stage utilization, Costumes, Innovation, Overall impact.

theature.Event:
Skit
Team Size: Upto 8 participants + 4 accompanists (max)
Time limit: 12-16 minutes (includes setup and clearance time)
1. Each presentation should have a title and a theme.
2. Medium of performing the Skit should be Hindi.
3. The Skit can involve multiple scenes and blackouts.
4. Backstage voice overs or sounds or narration are allowed during the Performance.
5. Background or Pre-recorded music is allowed.
Production material provided: 1 table, 2 chairs.
Any other production material has to be brought by the teams but the Organizers reserve the right to allow its use on the stage.
Judging Criteria: Presentation of the theme, Group co-ordination, Dialogue Delivery and Overall impact, Acting, Make-up and Costumes according to the Act.

Legendary Drama
Team size: No Limit.
Time Limit: 40-60 minutes +10 minutes stage setup.
1. The Drama should be based on Legend or Folk Lore.
2. Classical plays are allowed.
3. Extra 2 minutes for the introduction of the Drama.
4. Background dialogues or narration are allowed.
5. Multiple scenes or Blackouts are allowed.
Any other production material has to be brought by the teams but the Organizers reserve the right to allow its use on the stage.
Judging Criteria: Stage Setup, Acting, Dialogue Delivery, Make-up and Costumes according to Act, Overall Effect.

photo.Event:
Movie Making
Team Size: Unlimited as per required.
Time limit: Running time for each video (5-12min.): Maximum Fifteen (15) minutes, including any titles and/or credits. Entries longer than Fifteen (15) minutes will lead to negative marking.
Rules:
1. The Competition is open solely to original, newly-created Entries, or original, previously-created Entries which have not been distributed to the public (including, without limitation, display on the YouTube Website).
2. Members of other houses may appear in the movies but not allowed to play/have a significant role.
3. All Entries should be in Hindi (Partial use of other languages are allowed).
4. Clear Theme should be derivable from the film.
5. All entries are to be submitted on or before 3rd April 2015.
6. Animation movies are allowed.
Judging Criteria:
1. Storytelling
2. Creativity and originality.
3. Screenplay and Actor(s) Performances.
4. Technical Execution: Camera/Sound/Lighting/Editing.
5. Overall Impression.

Ad-Film Making
Team Size: Unlimited as per required.
Time limit: Running time for each video (20-60 sec): Maximum Twenty (20) seconds, including any titles and/or credits. Entries longer than Eighty (80) seconds will lead to negative marking.
Rules:
1. The Competition is open solely to original, newly-created Entries, or original, previously-created Entries which have not been distributed to the public (including, without limitation, display on the YouTube Website).
2. Members of other houses may appear in the movies but not allowed to play/have a significant role.
3. All Entries should be in Hindi (Partial use of other languages are allowed).
4. Clear Theme should be derivable from the Ad-Film.
5. All entries are to be submitted on or before 30th March 2015.
6. Animation movies are allowed.
Judging Criteria:
1. Creativity and originality.
2. Catchy and Attractive.
3. Technical Execution: Camera/Sound/Lighting/Editing.
4. Overall Impression.

special.Event:
Fashion Show
Team Size: 10 from each university/college, including 5 models and 1 main designer, 1 make-up designer, 1 hair designer and 2 assistant designer.
Rules
Each university/college has to prepare main design using colors according to the theme. Material may include products made from paper, plastics, rubber, etc. Use of Paper is allowed for making dresses but fabric should be used as the base and length of dress should be upto knee length and protective layers should be used.
Judging Criteria:
• Use of the colors.
• Original and creative approach.
• Overall Effect.
